pr_title: RHPAM-3119 : [Data Modeler] Unsaved changes dialog appears after rename

timeline.message:
RHPAM-3119 : [Data Modeler] Unsaved changes dialog appears after rename

 - DataObject is being send to the server if any change in Source or DataModeler
 - DataModeler context and source updated after package or file name changes
 - DataObject package and file name updates before  resolveSaveSource

timeline.author: caponetto

timeline.body:
Given the comment below `If the file was renamed as part of the file saving, don't do anything.`, 
would you mind explaining the reason for removing this `if-else` block?

Also, there is no unit test for exercising this method. 
It'd be great if you could create a few ones.
timeline.bodyText:
Given the comment below If the file was renamed as part of the file saving, don't do anything.,
would you mind explaining the reason for removing this if-else block?
Also, there is no unit test for exercising this method.
It'd be great if you could create a few ones.
timeline.bodyHTML:
Given the comment below If the file was renamed as part of the file saving, don't do anything.,
would you mind explaining the reason for removing this if-else block?

Also, there is no unit test for exercising this method.
It'd be great if you could create a few ones.
timeline.author: caponetto

replies.bodyText:
Hi @caponetto , The condition is used to identify if we have changed the package or file name. If the package or file name is changed, the source and source hash will be updated in reload because of ResourceRenamedEvent in the observable path. The "reload" caused some delay before the hash could be updated and the Unsaved changes dialog can appear. Removing this condition helps to update the source before reload.
The method is private so, didn't add the unit test for this.
replies.author: akumar074

replies.bodyText: I see, thanks for the explanation @akumar074!
replies.author: caponetto

timeline.bodyHTML:
I'd move this code into the if blocks above because there is no need for doing setName and setPackageName if name and package didn't change, respectively. It also avoids having to remove ".java" from targetName.

Something like this:

if (newPackageName != null && (currentPackage == null || !newPackageName.equals(currentPackage.getPackageName()))) {
    targetPackage = serviceHelper.ensurePackageStructure(moduleService.resolveModule(path),
                                                         newPackageName);

    // Moved here
    if (dataObject != null && targetPackage != null) {
        dataObject.setPackageName(targetPackage.getPackageName());
    }

    packageChanged = true;
}

if (newFileName != null && !(newFileName + ".java").equals(path.getFileName())) {
    targetName = newFileName + ".java";

    // Moved here
    if (dataObject != null) {
        dataObject.setName(newFileName);
    }

    nameChanged = true;
}
timeline.author: caponetto

replies.bodyText: Thanks @caponetto Good suggestion. I'll update this :)
replies.author: akumar074

replies.bodyText: Hey @caponetto , moving the DataObject update doesn't work as expected. The data object is also updated with fileName and currentPackage resolved from the path. For example, if we are changing the package or fileName in editor/source but while saving the changes we chose not to move the package or file name, then the source or DataObject editor can have changed values. In this case, we are updating the data object with the path or if package or fileName is changed update it.
replies.author: akumar074

replies.bodyText: I see, thanks for the explanation @akumar074!
replies.author: caponetto
